TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IPageAdapter implements class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Defines the interface to a page adapter. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All page adapters must implement this interface. This interface inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface, so any class that implements this interface must also implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface. The easiest solution is to derive a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> base class, which provides a default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .
Docs.related: Mobile Text Writer Rendering Best Practices
Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior

Docs.summary: Use this property to persist data between requests through the use of the URL query string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: A dictionary of data that has been persisted through the use of the URL query string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is populated when a valid <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> type is configured as an attribute of the < `mobileControls` > configuration element.

Docs.related: Mobile Text Writer Rendering Best Practices
Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior

Docs.param: object that contains request information, such as HTTP headers.
Collection of postback data from the request object.
Docs.summary: Called to determine the postback data collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.returns: A modified name value collection of post data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because some devices handle postback differently than others, this method allows the adapter to modify the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether items from the property are persisted in the query string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: if the items from the property are persisted in the query string; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is `true` by default, if the `CookielessDataDictionaryType` entry in the `MobileControls` configuration section of Web.config is set to a valid dictionary type.
